commitmsg: bump to 0.0.5 after publishing 0.0.4
changes in 0.0.4
improved handling of sloppy secondaries support documents
Remove bogus comments (copy/paste leftovers)

Eliminate a variable reuse in claims extraction

These two sets of claims should always be kept completely separate
so let's use separate variables at all times when handling them.
remove uneeded includes
use blanket for coverage, inline instrumentation ftw

Validate provisioning and authentication endpoints

Let's do this closer to the data, not deep into the callers of the
well-known parser.

Merge pull request #8 from fmarier/redirect_check

Make the redirect check more precise

Make the redirect check more precise

HTTP 304 (Not Modified) and 305 (Use Proxy) are not redirects so
they should probably not get the "redirects not allowed" error
message.

Not sure about 300 (Multiple Choices), but I left it out as well.
bump version to 0.0.4
update changelog for 0.0.3
IdP test library exports IdP object directly, not under a key - code cleanup and symmetry
export testing tools so that users of this library may use them to construct their own unit tests

tests passing for primary and secondary assertion issuers

Merge pull request #38 from mozilla/idp-multiple-pubkeys

Allow IdPs to publish multiple public keys. r=vladikoff

Allow IdPs to publish multiple public keys.

This allows the IdP support document to include a 'keys'
property containing a list of public keys, any of which
could be used to produce a valid signature.  IdPs might like
to use this during e.g. key rotation events.

tests.

use ass to check code coverage during test run

Validate the domain that's extracted from the cert email

The verifier makes use of the domain extracted from the email
address in a few places and so it should ensure that it's valid.
Test that chained assertions are rejected
Fix typo in comment

Simplify the audience comparison logic

Remove the regular expression-based parsing and replace it with
url.parse().

Add the default scheme when it's not provided.

Fix broken test

The ports need to match. This test was wrong.
Test invalid schemes when comparing audiences
Remove lie in comment
debug more easily with dbug()
changes in 0.0.6
fix issue with fallback being forgotten - pass along arguments - always.
sloppy support document test case is more wholistic - tests from assertion rather than lookup in isolation: this verifies that parameters are passed along from verification to lookup

Be more strict about the format of "disabled"

While we could be more tolerant here than in the spec, the risk is
that the majority of developers will not read the spec and will
instead try something with our verifier and expect that it will
always continue to work the same way.

In other words, if we're too lenient at the start, we will be
stuck supporting an alternative syntax forever and will impose that
on third-party verifiers as well.
Add a test to make sure that "disabled: false" works

Convert string exceptions to Error objects

http://www.devthought.com/2011/12/22/a-string-is-not-an-error/
improved error message
ver bump after publishing 0.0.5
changes in 0.0.5
allow over-riding of principal in client testing tool

Validate the authority field for delegating IdPs

The validation of that field should happen in the parser so that
invalid values never make it to the callers.
